comment:
PRE-REVIEW: COMPLIANT. All review criteria verified with evidence.

FRONTMATTER:
- title: "Agent Session Health Detection" -- present and non-empty.
- revision_summary: "Initial draft" -- present and appropriate for v0.1 (CR ID not required per SOP-001 Section 5.1).

DOCUMENT STRUCTURE (per SOP-002 Section 6):
All 12 required sections present and correctly numbered: Purpose (1), Scope (2, with 2.1 Context, 2.2 Changes Summary, 2.3 Files Affected), Current State (3), Proposed State (4), Change Description (5, with subsections 5.1-5.6), Justification (6), Impact Assessment (7, with 7.1-7.3), Testing Summary (8), Implementation Plan (9, with 9.1-9.6), Execution (10), Execution Summary (11), References (12).

PLACEHOLDER CHECK:
- No template placeholders (double-curly) found.
- No TBD, TODO, FIXME, or XXX found.
- Execution-phase placeholders ([SUMMARY], [Pass/Fail], etc.) are correctly present for post-release completion per SOP-004.

TRACEABILITY:
- Parent Document: "None (gap identified during UAT)" -- acceptable self-identified origin.
- References CR-069, SOP-001, SOP-002, SOP-004, and UAT session -- all valid.

SDLC GOVERNANCE:
- Sections 7.4/7.5 correctly omitted: agent-hub has no SDLC-HUB RS/RTM; it is not under SDLC governance.

EI TABLE:
- 7 execution items mapping cleanly to 6 implementation phases.
- Static columns (EI, Task Description) are populated; editable columns correctly contain placeholders.

CONTENT QUALITY:
- Problem clearly defined with observable symptoms.
- State transition diagram for STALE state is clear and correct.
- Testing Summary provides 6 concrete scenarios.
- Impact Assessment identifies Docker exec overhead as negligible.

NO DEFICIENCIES FOUND. Recommend for approval.

POST-REVIEW: NON-COMPLIANT. One deficiency found requiring correction.

WORKFLOW VERIFICATION:
- Audit trail confirms correct workflow sequence: DRAFT -> PRE_REVIEWED -> PRE_APPROVED (v1.0) -> IN_EXECUTION -> IN_POST_REVIEW (v1.2). Conforming.

EXECUTION TABLE (Section 10):
- All 7 EIs verified present with Task Outcome of Pass.
- All 7 EIs have substantive Execution Summary content with specific evidence (file paths, line numbers, method names, test results).
- All 7 EIs have signatures with dates.
- No residual execution placeholders ([SUMMARY], [Pass/Fail], [PERFORMER], [DATE]) remain.
- EI-7 performed by "lead, claude" confirming UAT was conducted.

EXECUTION COMMENTS:
- 2 substantive comments present, both signed and dated.
- Comment 1: Syntax verification and import chain validation.
- Comment 2: UAT findings (stale count, services display) with resolution.

BLOCKING VARs: None. No Fail outcomes exist.

DOCUMENTATION: Section 7.2 states no controlled documents affected. Confirmed.

SDLC PREREQUISITES: Not applicable (agent-hub is not under SDLC governance).

PRE-APPROVED CONTENT INTEGRITY: Sections 1-9 unchanged from pre-approved version. Confirmed.

PLACEHOLDER CHECK: No residual execution placeholders, no TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX. Confirmed.

DEFICIENCY:
Section 11 (Execution Summary), final sentence reads: "Commit: f2c64ec (implementation), services.py fix uncommitted pending checkin."

This statement is factually inaccurate. Git log shows commit 54da65f ("CR-070 IN_EXECUTION: UAT complete, services display fixes") exists after f2c64ec, demonstrating the services.py fix WAS committed. The Execution Summary contains stale text that was not updated to reflect the final execution state.

Per SOP-002 Section 7.3 item 4: "Evidence Documented: Completion evidence is recorded in the CR's Execution Summary column." The Execution Summary must accurately reflect the final state of execution. A statement claiming code is "uncommitted" when it has in fact been committed is a documentation error.

REQUIRED CORRECTION:
Update Section 11 to reference both commits accurately. Suggested correction: replace "Commit: f2c64ec (implementation), services.py fix uncommitted pending checkin" with text referencing both f2c64ec and 54da65f with accurate descriptions of what each commit contains.

After correction, re-route for post-review.

POST-REVIEW (re-review): COMPLIANT. Previously identified deficiency has been resolved.

DEFICIENCY RESOLUTION:
Prior deficiency: Section 11 contained stale text "services.py fix uncommitted pending checkin" when commit 54da65f existed.
Current text: "Commits: f2c64ec (implementation), 54da65f (UAT results and services display fixes)."
Both commits are now accurately referenced with descriptions. Stale text removed. RESOLVED.

DOCUMENT INTEGRITY:
Confirmed only the final sentence of Section 11 was modified (the correction). Sections 1-9 (pre-approved), Section 10 (EI table), Execution Comments, and Section 12 (References) are all unchanged from the prior review.

POST-REVIEW CRITERIA (SOP-002 Section 7.3):
1. Execution Complete: All 7 EIs show Task Outcome of Pass with signatures (claude - 2026-02-09; EI-7: lead, claude - 2026-02-09).
2. Blocking VARs: None. No Fail outcomes exist.
3. Documentation: No controlled documents affected (Section 7.2 states "None").
4. Evidence Documented: All EIs contain specific evidence (file paths, line numbers, method names, test results). Execution Summary references commits f2c64ec and 54da65f.
5. SDLC Prerequisites: N/A (agent-hub not under SDLC governance).

ADDITIONAL CHECKS:
- No residual execution placeholders remain.
- No TBD/TODO/FIXME/XXX found.
- Pre-approved content (Sections 1-9) unchanged from pre-approved version.
- Execution Comments: 2 substantive entries, both signed and dated.
- Formatting consistent throughout.

NO DEFICIENCIES FOUND. Recommend for approval.
